content: This folk art involves intricate geometric patterns painted on walls, trays, bamboo or fibre baskets, and is deeply ingrained in the Deevara community’s culture and traditions

content: Pete Rose was honored by the Reds on Wednesday night, a day after he was posthumously removed from MLB's permanent ineligibility list.

title: Sasaki unsure if velocity dip tied to shoulder issue
content: Roki Sasaki, who is on the injured list with a shoulder impingement, said he isn't sure if the injury is the main reason for an alarming dip in his fastball's velocity.

content: Manchester City are pushing to sign Florian Wirtz but face stiff competition from Bayern Munich, a source has told ESPN.

content: The NWSL Players Association said that play should have been stopped in the game between Angel City FC and the Utah Royals on Friday following the nearly 10-minute delay to provide medical attention to Savy King.

content: Dan Ndoye's second-half strike earned Bologna a hard-fought 1-0 victory over AC Milan in the Coppa Italia final on Wednesday to secure their first major trophy in 51 years.

content: Liverpool are in advanced talks to sign Jeremie Frimpong as a replacement for Trent Alexander-Arnold, sources have told ESPN.

content: Michael Rubin, a former Pentagon official and senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute, took a jibe at US President Donald Trump's tendency to claim credit for almost every achievement.

content: A former Pentagon official, Michael Rubin has said that India targeted terror infrastructure with precision, and it was able to blunt Pakistan's response following the recent strikes.

title: Pakistan "Pleads" With India To Reconsider Indus Waters Treaty Suspension
content: Pakistan has reportedly written a letter to India, urging it to reconsider the decision to put the Indus Waters Treaty into abeyance.

title: NDTV Exclusive: India Fighting Twin Wars - On Ground And Online
content: Since May 7, the day of India's strategic strike across the border, an advanced Command Center was established within the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

content: Dismantling years of US government policy of treating Syria like a pariah, President Donald Trump on Wednesday met Syrias interim president, Ahmad al-Sharaa.

title: Muslim Man Can Have Multiple Wives If He Treats All Of Them Equally: Court
content: A single bench of Justice Arun Kumar Singh Deswal made the remarks while hearing a petition to quash the chargesheet, cognisance, and summons order against a man, Furkan, issued by a court in Moradabad.

title: Watch: British MP Bob Blackman Calls For Action Against Terror Bases In PoK
content: British MP Bob Blackman has condemned the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmirs Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives, mostly tourists.

title: "They're Killing Poor Kids": Ben & Jerry's Founder Arrested From US Senate
content: Ben Cohen, cofounder of Ben &Jerry's ice cream and a longtime progressive activist, told AFP he was speaking for millions of Americans outraged by the "slaughter" in Gaza after his removal from a US Senate hearing on Wednesday.

title: Karnataka Cops Arrest 12 Over Online Jobs Scam
content: Twelve men have been arrested for cheating people online, extorting money from them with the promise of jobs.

title: How Trump's Syria Announcement Shocked US Allies, White House Officials
content: When President Donald Trump announced in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday that he would lift all sanctions on Syria, the decision - which will boost a country devastated by 13 years of war - took many in the region by surprise.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE: E-Commerce Platforms Directed To Take Down Merchandise With Pak Flags
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: India and Pakistan have been at loggerhead ever since the former launched Operation Sindoor, a counterstrike to Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla To Fly To Space From Same Launch Complex As Neil Armstrong
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is scheduled to pilot the Axiom Mission 4, a private astronaut mission that will launch aboard a SpaceX Dragon capsule on a Falcon 9 rocket.

title: "Nothing Personal": Qatar PM Dismisses Concerns Over Trump Jet Gift Offer
content: Qatar's offer to donate a luxury jet to the United States was not a personal gift to President Donald Trump but a "government-to-government transaction," the Gulf nation's prime minister said Wednesday.

title: UK, Germany To Jointly Develop 2,000-Km-Range Strike Weapon
content: Britain and Germany will jointly develop a new "deep precision strike" weapon with a range exceeding 2,000 kilometres (1,242 miles), the British government said on Thursday, as Europe's two largest economies step up their defence cooperation.

title: Trump, Putin To Skip Russia-Ukraine Negotiation Talks In Turkey
content: U.S. President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin will not attend what could be the first direct peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv in three years on Thursday, the Kremlin sending instead a group of experienced technocrats.

title: 10 Militants Killed In Gunfight With Assam Rifles In Manipur's Chandel
content: At least 10 militants were killed in a gunfight with an Assam Rifles unit in Manipur's Chandel district on Wednesday, officials said.

title: Congress Accuses BJP Of Politicising Operation Sindoor
content: Senior Congress leader and MP Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday accused BJP of politicising the 'Operation Sindoor' and said there are reports that PM Modi will meet Chief Ministers of NDA-ruled states over Operation Sindoor.

title: At BRICS, Nitin Gadkari Highlights Government's Transport Initiatives
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday represented India at the BRICS Transport Ministers' Meet in Brasilia, Brazil, articulating India's commitment to building a sustainable, resilient, and future-ready transport infrastructure.

title: Over 20 People Dead In Mexico Highway Accident
content: At least 21 people died in an auto accident on Wednesday on a highway connecting Mexico's Oaxaca and Puebla states, a top state official said.

title: With ‘special troops train’, govt signals J&K plan’s on track
content: Indian Railways successfully conducted a trial run of a special train on the Katra-Qazigund section. This section includes the Chenab Bridge. The train carried soldiers and completed a round trip with full security. This trial is significant due to the ongoing Indo-Pak conflict. The new rail line will improve connectivity to Kashmir.

title: ‘Main bol raha hoon’: BSF jawan's first call home melts wife’s heart
content: BSF Jawan Purnam Shaw returned to India after 22 days in Pakistan custody, bringing immense relief to his family in Kolkata. His wife, Rajni, confirmed his identity through a phone call and shared the news with their son. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee assured Rajni of Purnam's well-being and expressed her desire to meet him upon his return.

title: ‘Gutter language’: HC slams BJP minister, orders FIR for remark against Col Qureshi
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has taken suo motu cognizance of state minister Vijay Shah's derogatory remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, ordering the DGP to file an FIR. The court condemned Shah's “gutter language” as disparaging to both the officer and the armed forces.

title: 'Why, Virat? We all still need you!': Tharoor pays glowing tribute to Kohli
content: Shashi Tharoor expressed his sadness over Virat Kohli's unexpected retirement from Test cricket, calling him "immortal in whites." Tharoor reminisced about their meeting and admired Kohli's Test performances, lamenting the absence of a farewell match. Kohli's exit at 36 marks the end of an era, leaving a void as India prepares for the next World Test Championship cycle.

title: 10 militants killed in gunfight with Assam Rifles in Manipur's Chandel
content: The Army's Eastern Command said in a post on X, "Acting on specific intelligence on movement of armed cadres nearby New Samtal village, Khengjoy Tehsil, Chandel District near the Indo-Myanmar Border, Assam Rifles unit under Spear Corps launched an operation on 14 May 2025."

title: Melinda Gates on when she realised its time to end marriage with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a recurring dream of standing on a crumbling cliff with Bill Gates and their children influenced her decision to divorce. This dream, along with surfacing information like Bill's association with Jeffrey Epstein, served as a catalyst. She also experienced panic attacks during the separation, highlighting the emotional toll of ending their 27-year marriage.

title: To return or not: Foreign players face dilemma ahead of IPL resumption
content: IPL franchises face disruption as international cricket schedules clash with the league's resumption. South Africa's directive to recall players for the WTC final by May 26th creates challenges, impacting teams like Gujarat Titans and Punjab Kings. England's ODI series against West Indies further complicates matters, potentially affecting teams like Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Sky-high valour: Bihar’s sons at helm of Operation Sindoor
content: Air Marshal Awadesh Kumar Bharti, hailing from Purnia, Bihar, played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor as the DG Air Operations, avenging the Pahalgam killings. Inspired by the establishment of a military airbase in his town after the 1962 war, he excelled in Sainik School and NDA, earning prestigious awards for his service.

title: After message to Pakistanis, what Ranveer Allahbadia said on Piers Morgan show
content: YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia faced backlash for a peace message to Pakistanis, which he quickly deleted. He then appeared on Piers Morgan's show, confronting Pakistani panelists with evidence of Bin Laden's proximity to a Pakistani military base and a UN-designated terrorist being honored by the Pakistani military.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens on a choppy note; BSE Sensex near 81,300
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started trade on a choppy note on Thursday. While Nifty50 was near 24,650, BSE Sensex was below 81,300.

title: India meets UN counter-terror officials, pushes for listing of LeT front TRF
content: An Indian delegation met with UN officials to bolster counter-terrorism cooperation following the Pahalgam attack claimed by a Lashkar-e-Taiba front. Discussions revisited commitments from the 2022 Delhi Declaration and addressed threats from unmanned aerial systems and terrorist financing. The meeting occurred amidst heightened tensions and military actions between India and Pakistan after the attack.

title: Google's shareholders get an 'Israel request': We believe this proposal is ...
content: Jewish advocacy groups are urging Alphabet shareholders to reject a proposal demanding an investigation into Google's Project Nimbus. The proposal, set for a vote at the company's annual meeting scheduled to be held on June 6, 2025, targets Alphabet's contracts with the Israeli government. Late last year, Google fired over 20 employees after protests over Project Nimbus.

title: Kerala LSS USS scholarship result 2025 declared; download here
content: The Kerala Pareeksha Bhavan has declared the LSS and USS Scholarship Exam Results 2025 on May 14, 2025. Students can check their results at bpekerala.in using their registration number and date of birth. The LSS cut-off is 48 marks, and the USS cut-off is 63 marks. Qualified students must submit verification documents by June 15, 2025. Re-evaluation applications are open until May 31, 2025. The scholarships support academically talented students from Classes 4 and 7.

title: 'Virat Kohli put his heart and soul into Test cricket'
content: Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket has drawn widespread acclaim, with legends like Atherton and Hussain lauding his transformative impact. Kohli ended his career with 9,230 runs in 123 Tests. Atherton admired Kohli's passion, while Hussain highlighted his aura and leadership. Kohli's captaincy saw India become the No. 1 Test side for 42 months, marking a fearless era.

title: Can SC fix deadlines for President, governors’ assent to bills?: Murmu
content: President Murmu has sought the Supreme Court's opinion on the validity of its recent verdict that set deadlines for governors and the President to decide on state bills. Questioning the constitutional basis for such timelines, she invoked Article 143(1) to address concerns about the court's overreach and the concept of deemed assent, deeming it alien to the constitutional framework.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for today
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha suggests a positive outlook for Nifty and Bank Nifty, setting targets at 24900/25400 and a range of 54500-55900, respectively. Havells, Adani Energy Solutions, and HCL Technologies are top buy recommendations.

title: IAEA says no report of radiation leak from any Pak facility
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has refuted claims of a radiation leak from any Pakistani nuclear facility, following reports that Indian missiles struck Kirana Hills during Operation Sindoor. This clarification counters widespread social media speculation and foreign media theories. The IAEA confirmed that, based on available information, no radiation release occurred.

title: Pakistan's appeal to India: Rethink suspension of Indus Waters Treaty
content: Pakistan has appealed to India to reconsider its decision to keep the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, citing the dependence of millions on the regulated water. India, however, remains firm on its decision, taken in response to terrorist activities, asserting that changed circumstances and Pakistan's actions warrant a reevaluation of the treaty.

title: When Aishwarya broke the internet with purple lipstick at Cannes Film Festival
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes Film Festival appearances are always a highlight, especially her bold fashion choices. In 2016, her purple lipstick became a viral sensation, sparking both praise and criticism. Amitabh Bachchan defended her look, emphasizing social media's role in self-expression and the fleeting nature of trends. Now, as Cannes 2025 begins, fans eagerly anticipate Aishwarya's next iconic moment.

title: Pak inked deal with crypto company in which Trump kin has 60% stake
content: Donald Trump's renewed interest in mediating between India and Pakistan coincides with a recent deal between Pakistan's Crypto Council and World Liberty Financial (WLF), a cryptocurrency venture with Trump family ties. This partnership, involving figures like Zachary Witkoff, raises questions about potential connections between the crypto deal and Trump's shift in stance on the Indo-Pak conflict.

title: Ax-4, with India’s Shubhanshu Shukla, to liftoff on June 8
content: Axiom Space's Ax-4 mission, piloted by India’s Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is scheduled to launch to the ISS on June 8. The mission, carried by a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, will include astronauts from India, Poland, and Hungary, marking a return to human spaceflight for each nation after over four decades.

title: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak’s Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: Overseas borrowing surges to 5-year high
content: India's private sector is witnessing a surge in investment, with companies securing a record $11 billion in external commercial borrowings (ECBs) in March 2025. This five-year high, driven by confidence in India's economic prospects, saw approvals granted to firms like Foxconn's Yuzhan Technology and JSW Steel. For FY25, total ECB proposals reached $61.

title: ‘Raid 2’ collection: Ajay Devgn’s crime drama mints over Rs 174 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' is maintaining a strong box office presence, nearing Rs 174 crore worldwide. Despite a slight dip in earnings on Day 14, the film continues to attract viewers, driven by its compelling storyline and performances. It's now poised to potentially surpass Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' in global earnings and eyes the Rs 150 crore mark in India.

title: High court fines firm for fraudulent GST tax credit claim
content: The Delhi High Court has raised concerns about the misuse of a Central Goods and Services Tax Act provision, fining a firm for fraudulently claiming input tax credit (ITC) to evade full GST payment. The court highlighted the potential damage to the GST framework from such large-scale fraud involving fake invoices.

title: Judge orders Indian student released from ICE detention
content: A federal judge ordered the release of a Georgetown scholar detained in Texas, citing substantial constitutional claims against the Trump administration regarding free speech. Simultaneously, a Wisconsin judge was indicted for allegedly aiding an undocumented immigrant, while another judge cleared the way for deporting a Venezuelan man under the Alien Enemies Act, requiring due process.

title: Lost it on Wegovy? You might gain it all back in a year
content: A recent study presented at the European Congress on Obesity reveals that individuals using weight loss drugs, including newer GLP-1 medications, tend to regain all lost weight within a year of discontinuing the medication. While these drugs effectively induce weight loss, maintaining a healthy lifestyle through diet and exercise remains crucial for long-term success.

title: Anushka & Virat’s heartwarming family moment with Vamika and Akaay
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have always stood as one of the most admired celebrity couples, not just for their professional excellence, but also for the genuine bond they share as life partners and parents. Recently, after Virat Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket, the family sought spiritual peace and blessings at an ashram in Vrindavan. And now, a heartwarming video showing a rare glimpse into their private family time has surfaced online.

title: 21-day ‘biggest-ever op’ leaves 31 Maoists dead
content: Security forces concluded a 21-day anti-Maoist operation in Karreguttalu Hills. Thirty-one Maoist bodies were recovered. The operation scattered the Maoist command. Amit Shah called it the biggest assault on Maoists. Forces faced difficult terrain. They cleared caves housing arms manufacturing units. The operation busted a major Maoist stronghold. Disjointed Maoist formations are taking shelter in different places.

title: It’s time a performance audit of HC judges is done: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has voiced concerns over high court judges frequently taking unnecessary breaks, suggesting a need for performance audits to assess their output relative to expenditure. This observation arose during a case where the Jharkhand HC delayed pronouncing a verdict, prompting the SC to emphasize adherence to judgment timelines and propose a monitoring mechanism.

title: Tata Power to bid for UP discoms in core business push
content: Tata Power will bid for Dakshinanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam and Purvanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam in Uttar Pradesh. The company aims to expand its transmission and distribution business. Tata Power currently serves 12.5 million customers and wants to reach 40 million in five years. The company is also awaiting legal clarity on small modular nuclear reactors.

title: Tech glitches disrupt CUET-UG day-2 in conflict-hit J&K, Delhi
content: CUET-UG 2025's second day was marred by technical and logistical failures, impacting over 350 students in J&K and Delhi. Exam cancellations in Srinagar and centre allocation issues in Meghalaya caused significant distress. Students faced challenges like power outages, distant exam centres, and inadequate facilities, raising concerns about the NTA's preparedness and student welfare.

title: Matthews, his fans get emotional as his mother opened up about struggles
content: Ema Matthews, Auston Matthews' mother, worked tirelessly at multiple jobs, including Starbucks, to finance his hockey dream. Facing the financial challenges of the sport, especially as a family with Mexican heritage, she made significant sacrifices. Her dedication enabled Auston to pursue his passion, ultimately contributing to his rise as an NHL star and inspiring others from underrepresented backgrounds in hockey.

title: Odisha clears 11% SEBC quota for admissions in higher education
content: The Odisha cabinet, under CM Mohan Charan Majhi, has approved 11.25% reservation for SEBC in higher education, excluding medical and engineering colleges. This policy, effective this academic year, applies to various courses in government and aided institutions. CM Majhi criticized previous governments for neglecting social justice for backward classes, while Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan hailed the move as historic.

title: US defence strategist hails India’s ‘decisive victory’
content: Military strategist John Spencer says India won Operation Sindoor. He says India destroyed terrorist infrastructure. India demonstrated military superiority. The operation unveiled a new national security doctrine. Spencer notes India's response was overwhelming yet controlled. He adds India handled the crisis without international mediation. India enforced its doctrine on sovereign terms. The operation redefined strategic equation.

title: Indians ground Turkiye, Azerbaijan travel plans
content: Following Türkiye and Azerbaijan's support for Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, Indian tourism to these nations has plummeted. Travel agencies report widespread cancellations and a halt in new bookings due to public anger over perceived hostile actions. The shift reflects a growing sentiment that tourism revenue should not support countries seen as opposing India, leading travelers to explore alternative destinations.

title: 'His demeanor has been unbelievable': Fans rage as Marner praises Matthews
content: Auston Matthews, despite a scoring drought in the series against Florida, retains the unwavering support of his Maple Leafs teammates. Mitch Marner emphasizes Matthews' positive attitude and overall contribution beyond goals. As Toronto aims to regain the series lead in Game 5, a breakout performance from Matthews could be the turning point they need against the defensively strong Panthers.

title: Pakistani crew on Hong Kong-flagged ship not allowed to disembark
content: A Hong Kong-flagged tanker, MT Siren II, arrived near Paradip port with crude oil. The tanker had twenty-one Pakistani crew members. Security agencies prevented them from disembarking as a precaution. The vessel is carrying oil for the Indian Oil Corporation refinery. Other crew members from India and Thailand faced no restrictions.

title: 5 hrs after HC deadline, MP cops file FIR against minister Vijay Shah
content: Madhya Pradesh police filed a case against minister Vijay Shah. The action followed a high court order regarding Shah's remarks about Col Sofia Quereshi. The court deemed his comments dangerous. Shah faces charges under the Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita. These charges include endangering national sovereignty and promoting disharmony. The sections carry potential imprisonment and fines. Shah's comments sparked widespread criticism.

title: Tailor arrested at Bathinda base for leaking sensitive info to Pak
content: In Bathinda, authorities arrested Raqib, a tailor working at the military station. This follows the earlier arrest of a cobbler. Raqib, a Roorkee resident, is suspected of sending sensitive information. His mobile is under forensic analysis. Police are investigating the case after the army handed him over. The military base was previously a target during Operation Sindoor.

title: Pro-Pak post sparks violence in West Bengal, cops hurt
content: Violent clashes erupted in Barasat, West Bengal, leaving at least three police officers injured, one seriously, after a social media post allegedly supporting Pakistan triggered outrage. Nazir Hossain, accused of uploading the controversial Facebook post, was arrested. Thirteen others were detained for inciting violence and attacking police during the ensuing protest.

title: Rangers hand over BSF trooper, India lets Pak soldier go home
content: BSF constable Purnam Kumar Shaw, held in Pakistan for 22 days after inadvertently crossing the Punjab border, was released Wednesday. The handover at Attari-Wagah followed tense diplomatic efforts amid Operation Sindoor. Shaw's family in Bengal rejoiced, with his pregnant wife Rajni expressing immense relief. His return coincided with a Pakistani soldier crossing back into Pakistan from Rajasthan.

title: Indigenous ‘Bhargavastra’ test-fired successfully
content: Nagpur's Solar Defence and Aerospace Ltd (SDAL) has successfully tested its anti-drone system, "Bhargavastra," in Odisha. The system can launch 64 micro rockets in a single burst to neutralize drone swarms and disrupt UAVs. This indigenous system will establish a two-layered drone defense, utilizing unguided micro-rockets for broad impact and micro-missiles for precise targeting, enhancing protection against drone attacks.
